comments.text:
Hahaha. Very clever. Sooooo very clever. Maybe to clever. For years many 
have point out that most victims of islamic fascism have brown faces and 
are very often muslim. The answer has been that we westerners shouldn't 
mess with other people's affairs. So we counter that by saying " what about 
human rights?, aren't human rights universal?"Aperantly not. Human rights 
are a western construct. 
So now , 12 people are murdered in France. Some because they were 
comedians, a few because they were jewish and 1 because he was muslim and a 
police officer. We felt bad about it. But wait.!!! We are hipocrites. Why? 
Because of all the Nigerians that were murdered. Basically the people that 
didn't give a fuck about the thousands of iraqis that were murdered are 
telling us nowvwe should not mourn the assassinated french and if we do it 
it's because we are racist and we don't care about Nigerians.
Fuck you Jon Steward and fuck you Trevor Noah! You are morally bankrupt. 
Fuck you!﻿
comments.author: Jorge Espinha

comments.text:
this is so not funny. But how do you make jokes about Boko Haram? 
At least they acknowledged that #bringbackourgirls  was a national 
movement. ( #notheydidnt  was a pretty good joke that didn't get any 
laughs.) I guess that when they didn't bring our girls back, we just turned 
our heads somewhere else.﻿
comments.author: stxyn

comments.text:
It seems more likely that the Charlie Hebdo attacks weren't actually 
carried out because of the cartoons, which is kinda weird because a lot of 
people believe it to be, it seems more likely that the attacks were carried 
out to aggravate the majority and the government into lashing out and 
discriminate Muslims in France (who have one of the lowest turnover levels 
of recruits to ISIS) to make them feel more disenfranchised and 
discriminated against in an environment of already slight, but noticeable, 
institutionalised Islamophobia, thereby increasing the chances of more 
Muslims from France joining ISIS. They employed this technique in Iraq as 
well by bombing Shia holy sites, relying on the government taking a tougher 
stance against Sunnis and making it more likely that those disenfranchised 
Sunnis would join ISIS. It also didn't help that everyone posted that 
picture of the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH).﻿

popularity and credibility.

comments.text:
Maybe for poorly informed people this was new and cutting edge.  This is 
all old news, nigerian president goodluck jonathan spent months denying 
boko haram was a real problem and then was hostile to any attempt for 
support from outside Nigeria. Very ignorant of trevor and jon assuming 
Americans in power don't know exactly how much oil nigeria has.

This is also ridiculous piece acting as if people don't know what Boko 
haram means and stands for, even the 'dummies' at FOX and their viewers 
know exactly what boko haram stands for.They create this perception that 
tens of millions in America don't know what's going on, but it is very 
apparent that the people who don't know what's going on are a large group 
of jon stewarts viewers.  Stop being ignorant and lazy many of you and read 
New york times, the Economist, Washington Post, New Yorker weekly et and 
for your own opinion- DON'T BE A DUMMY AND STOP USING TV NEWS OR SATIRE AS 
YOUR SOURCE.﻿

 He's not a typical American liberal- he is anti-american which the

I'm gonna give him a chance, fair and unbiased. I don't think there is 
anyone who could truly replace Jon but the show must go on and I'm not 
going to stop watching because he's leaving. Up to this point I haven't 
found Noah that amusing but it takes a while for a comedian to really hit a 
stride that they can make a brand of. And I did think that most of those 
jokes on Twitter were in bad taste(which I could tolerate better if they 
were funnier), but I've seen lots of stuff that's in bad taste juxtaposed 
to lots of amusing, good content from the same people. So give him a shot. 
At the very least he may surprise you.﻿

comments.author: deanojones1000

comments.text:
What made Jon Stewart so important to the show was that he wasn't a 
controversial character in his personal life and he was American himself 
(making fun of his own country). It diminishes the punch line and the jokes 
when the integrity of the character delivering them is questionable 
(tweets...). Look at Bill Cosby, do you dare laugh at any of his jokes? No. 
Because with all these sexual assault accusations, it makes the jokes more 
real, and imagination and exaggeration is what gives jokes their punch.﻿
